message: Well, for sure - it would be a shame if they left. But, the state of Ohio hasn't done a whole lot to entice them to stay up until recently. Cuyahoga County in particular. I'd be surpised if they left, because - as the story says - the Brooklyn location is their largest and most productive. But, at the same time, if they can get similar production without the hassles of being in Ohio, it would make sense for them to leave.
